dissolved gas concentration fields and measurements of wave slope at a wavy free water surface with wind-induced turbulence</article-title>       </title-group>       <contrib-group>         <contrib contrib-type="author">           <name>             <surname>Friedl</surname>             <given-names>Felix</given-names>           </name>           <aff>             <institution>Institut f\ufffd\ufffdr Umweltphysik, Heidelberg University</institution>           </aff>         </contrib>         <contrib contrib-type="author">           <name>             <surname>J\ufffd\ufffdhne</surname>             <given-names>Bernd</given-names>           </name>           <aff>             <institution>Interdisciplinary Center for Scientific Computing (IWR), Heidelberg University</institution>           </aff>         </contrib>         <contrib contrib-type="author">           <name>             <surname>Herzog</surname>             <given-names>Alexandra</given-names>           </name>           <aff>             <institution>Institut f\ufffd\ufffdr Umweltphysik, Heidelberg University</institution>           </aff>         </contrib>       </contrib-group>       <pub-date pub-type="pub">         <year>2010</year>       </pub-date>       <self-uri xlink:href="http://zenodo.org/record/15132"/>       <self-uri xlink:href="http://ltces.dem.ist.utl.pt/lxlaser/lxlaser2010/"/>       <self-uri xlink:href="https://zenodo.org/record/15132/files/HerzogFriedlJaehne_SympApplLaserTechFluidMech_Lisbon2010a.pdf"/>     </article-meta>     <abstract><p>In this study we present a significantly improved LIF technique that is suitable for high-resolution measurements of dissolved gas concentration fields in a vertical plane oriented in wind-direction close to a wavy water surface in wind/wave facilities.</p></abstract>   </front>   <article-type>user-asi</article-type> </article>   </articles>
